name: Moong Chilla with Palak
history: Chilla, also known as cheela, is a popular North Indian breakfast item. The addition of palak (spinach) adds a healthful twist to the traditional moong dal chilla.
description: A savory pancake made from ground moong dal and spinach, spiced with Indian flavors. It's a healthy and delicious option for any meal.

instructions.title: Soak and Grind Moong Dal
instructions.description: Soak moong dal in water for 1 hour. Drain and transfer to a blender.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: To the blender, add spinach, green chili, ginger, cumin seeds, and salt. Add a little water and blend to a smooth batter.

instructions.title: Cook the Chilla
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick pan and grease it lightly with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it into a thin pancake. Cook until the bottom side is golden, then flip and cook the other side.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the moong chilla hot with chutney or yogurt.

tips: Ensure the batter is not too thick; it should be pourable.
Adding finely chopped onions and tomatoes to the batter can enhance the flavor.
variations: Mix in grated carrots or beets for added nutrition and color.
For a vegan version, omit yogurt in the serving suggestion.

storage.shelfLife: Batter can be stored for up to 1 day in the refrigerator
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container. Cooked chillas are best enjoyed fresh.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a pan over medium heat for best results.
presentationTips: Serve on a colorful plate with a side of bright green mint chutney.
